Package managers

Class UserManager

java.lang.Object
managers.UserManager
public class UserManager extends Object
USER MANAGER CLASS
The User Manager will be in charge of logging in and logging out.
User Manager will also be used in authorizing the company representative only is a staff account is used.

    Getter Function
    ArrayList<User>
    getRespectiveUserList(String ID)
    Method to get list of user type at login stage, where there is no current user in the program.
    User's ID decides which list is used.
    void
    login(String ID, String password)
    Login function checks the inputted ID, password and login state.
    If both ID and password were entered correctly, and login state is false, the user will sucessfully login.
    Else, user will be unable to login.
    void
    logout()
    Logout function sets the current user's login state to false, and then clears the current user from User Manager.
    System message displayed in program to let user know they have logged out.

    • UserManager

      public UserManager(ArrayList<User> studentList, ArrayList<User> repList, ArrayList<User> staffList)
      Class Constructor
      Ensure each object list is loaded accordingly eg. Student list from main code is loaded into Student list in User Manager.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentUser

      public User getCurrentUser()
      Getter Function
      Returns:
      Just the current User object

    • clearCurrentUser

      public void clearCurrentUser()
      Setter Function

    • getRespectiveUserList

      public ArrayList<User> getRespectiveUserList(String ID)
      Method to get list of user type at login stage, where there is no current user in the program.
      User's ID decides which list is used.
      1. If the ID inputted by the user starts with "U"/"u", user is a student
      2. If the ID inputted by the user starts with "CR"/"cr", user is a company representative
      3. Else, user is a staff
      Returns:
      The respective list of objects associated with the ID.

    • login

      public void login(String ID, String password)
      Login function checks the inputted ID, password and login state.
      If both ID and password were entered correctly, and login state is false, the user will sucessfully login.
      Else, user will be unable to login.

    • logout

      public void logout()
      Logout function sets the current user's login state to false, and then clears the current user from User Manager.
      System message displayed in program to let user know they have logged out.
